parse.title: List of dialling codes in Ukraine

text.*:
Country Code: +380
International Call Prefix: 0~0
Trunk Prefix: 0~

Note: After annexation by Russia, Crimea switched to the Russian telephone codes +7 978 for mobile phones and +7 365 for landlines on 7 May 2015.[nb 1][3]

69 – Sevastopol[edit]

  • 69 – Sevastopol

Note: After annexation by Russia, Crimea switched to the Russian telephone codes +7 978 for mobile phones and +7 869 for landlines at Sevastopol on 7 May 2015.[3]

See also[edit]

  • Telephone numbers in Ukraine
  • Area codes

Notes[edit]

  1. ^ The status of the Crimea and of the city of Sevastopol is currently under dispute between Russia and Ukraine; Ukraine and the majority of the international community consider the Crimea to be an autonomous republic of Ukraine and Sevastopol to be one of Ukraine's cities with special status, while Russia, on the other hand, considers the Crimea to be a federal subject of Russia and Sevastopol to be one of Russia's three federal cities.[1][2]

References[edit]

  1. ^ Steve Gutterman; Pavel Polityuk (March 18, 2014). "Putin signs Crimea treaty, will not seize other Ukraine regions". Reuters. Archived from the original on July 9, 2014. Retrieved June 4, 2014. 
  2. ^ "Ukraine crisis timeline". BBC News. November 13, 2014. Archived from the original on June 4, 2014. Retrieved June 4, 2014. 
  3. ^ a b Crimea switches to Russian telephone codes, Interfax-Ukraine (7 May 2015)
